history.content: You should be fine waiting until July. Most companies don't really start actually recruiting until August/September anyways. I don't think you'll be losing out on anything.

children.subject:
You’re totally fine waiting until July. I’ve never started doing anything until August or so. 

Definitely better to be prepared than to go in early and not do well. Most of the actual hiring happens August through October in my experience.

history.content:
Hey Community!

I'm a rising senior (CS and Linguistics double major with possible S Asian minor, for whom it may concern) who is looking to get a position in a tech company after I graduate.While I know that everyone says "apply early and often," I'm getting a bit anxious about the application timeline.

I feel like I need another month of working on my personal project and preparing for technical interviews before I can tell companies that I'm ready to apply. People (largely my family) are telling me that this is a mistake and that I should be applying ASAP to not miss out on the competitive spots and such. This doesn't make sense to me entirely since recruiters won't be on campus till the fall semester starts, but nonetheless, it's causing me a lot of stress.

To be frank, I honestly don't think I'm quite ready just yet to apply and I feel like I need the time to do the things I mentioned above, collect myself, and polish my resume. My question is: Is it okay to wait a month and start applying in mid July, or is it better to just begin applying to jobs now?
history.subject: Can I Postpone Applying for a Job till Mid-July
